answers.text:
Hi David, 
To answer your questions I have attached some of the resources that the Knowledge Network has on this topic. 
This previously asked question includes an RFP for vehicle tracking so you can see what other local governments want to do on this topic. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/20526/GPS_trackingvehicle_monitoring
In this previously asked question you can learn about the ethics of vehicle tracking from the resources attached in the answer http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/23046
In this vehicle equipment plan you can learn how vehicles are being tracked and which ones they are tracking, icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/305727
I hope you find these resources useful and that other local government officials chime in and provide you with their experiences on this growing topic. 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: David Dillner
text:
Do you install GPS tracking systems on vehicles in the City fleet? If so, do you install them in all vehicles in the fleet or just certain vehicles? How do you determine which vehicles to track? 
Are employees made aware that vehicles are being tracked? How did you address the organizational culture with respect to implementing a tracking system?
How is the information reviewed and used? Did your insurance premiums go down once vehicles were able to be tracked?
Any other information on this subject that relates to how your City has implemented a vehicle tracking program would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks.
title: GPS Tracking Vehicles
